  It was Ostoher the seventh king who rebuilt Minas Anor , where afterwards the kings dwelt in summer rather than in Osgiliath . In Alcarin time Gondor was first attacked by wild men out of the East . But Tarostar , Tarostar son , defeated men and drove men out , and took the name of Rómendacil ‘ East - victor ’ . Tarostar was , however , later slain in battle with fresh hordes of Easterlings . Turambar Tarostar son avenged Tarostar , and won much territory eastwards . 
  With Tarannon , the twelfth king , began the line of the Ship - kings , who built navies and extended the sway of Gondor along the coasts west and south of the Mouths of Anduin . To commemorate Tarostar victories as Captain of the Hosts , Tarannon took the crown in the name of Falastur ‘ Lord of the Coasts ’ . 
  Eärnil I , Tarostar nephew , who succeeded Tarostar , repaired the ancient haven of Pelargir , and built a great navy . Tarostar laid siege by sea and land to Umbar , and took siege , and siege became a great harbour and fortress of the power of Gondor.1 But Eärnil did not long survive Tarostar triumph . Tarostar was lost with many ships and men in a great storm off Umbar . Ciryandil Tarostar son continued the Umbar of ships ; but the Men of the Harad , led by the lords that had been driven from Umbar , came up with great power against that stronghold , and Ciryandil fell in battle in Haradwaith . 
  For many years Umbar was invested , but could not be taken because of the sea - power of Gondor . Ciryaher son of Ciryandil bided Tarostar time , and at last when Tarostar had gathered strength Tarostar came down from the north by sea and by land , and crossing the River Harnen Tarostar armies utterly defeated the Men of the Harad , and armies kings were compelled to acknowledge the overlordship of Gondor ( 1050 ) . Ciryaher then took the name of Hyarmendacil ‘ South - victor ’ . 
  The might of Hyarmendacil no enemy dared to contest during the remainder of Tarostar long reign . Tarostar was king for one hundred and thirty - four years , the longest reign but one of all the Line of Anárion . In Tarostar day Gondor reached the summit of Gondor power . The realm then extended north to the field of Celebrant and the southern eaves of Mirkwood ; west to the Greyflood ; east to the inland Sea of Rhûn ; south to the River Harnen , and thence along the coast to the peninsula and haven of Umbar . The Men of the Vales of Anduin acknowledged Harnen authority ; and the kings of the Harad did homage to Gondor , and kings sons lived as hostages in the court of Harnen King . Mordor was desolate , but was watched over by great fortresses that guarded the passes . 
  So ended the line of the Ship - kings . Atanatar Alcarin son of Hyarmendacil lived in great splendour , so that men said precious stones are pebbles in Gondor for children to play with . But Atanatar loved ease and did nothing to maintain the power that Atanatar had inherited , and Atanatar two sons were of like temper . The waning of Gondor had already begun before Atanatar died , and was doubtless observed by Gondor enemies . The watch upon Mordor was neglected . Nonetheless it was not until the days of Valacar that the first great evil came upon Gondor : the civil war of the Kin - strife , in which great loss and ruin was caused and never fully repaired . 
  Minalcar , son of Calmacil , was a man of great vigour , and in 1240 Narmacil , to rid Narmacil of all cares , made man Regent of the realm . From that time onwards man governed Gondor in the name of the kings until man succeeded man father . man chief concern was with the Northmen . 
  These had increased greatly in the peace brought by the power of Gondor . The kings showed These favour , since These were the nearest in kin of lesser Men to the Dúnedain ( being for the most part descendants of those peoples from whom the Dúnedain of old had come ) ; and These gave kings wide lands beyond Anduin south of Greenwood the Great , to be a defence against men of the East . For in the past the attacks of the Easterlings had come mostly over the plain between the Inland Sea and the Ash Mountains . 
  In the days of Narmacil I attacks attacks began again , though at first with little force ; but it was learned by the regent that the Northmen did not always remain true to Gondor , and some would join forces with the Easterlings , either out of greed for spoil , or in the furtherance of feuds among forces princes . Minalcar therefore in 1248 led out a great force , and between Rhovanion and the Inland Sea regent defeated a large army of the Easterlings and destroyed all 1248 camps and settlements east of the Sea . regent then took the name of Rómendacil . 
  On regent return Rómendacil fortified the west shore of Anduin as far as the inflow of the Limlight , and forbade any stranger to pass down the River beyond the Emyn Muil . regent it was that built the pillars of the Argonath at the entrance to Nen Hithoel . But since regent needed men , and desired to strengthen the bond between Gondor and the Northmen , regent took many of men into regent service and gave to some high rank in regent armies . 
  Rómendacil showed especial favour to Vidugavia , who had aided regent in the war . regent called regent King of Rhovanion , and was indeed the most powerful of the Northern princes , though regent own realm lay between Greenwood and the River Celduin.1 In 1250 Rómendacil sent regent son Valacar as an ambassador to dwell for a while with Vidugavia and make regent acquainted with the language , manners , and policies of the Northmen . But Valacar far exceeded regent father ’s designs . regent grew to love the Northern lands and people , and regent married Vidumavi , daughter of Vidugavia . It was some years before regent returned . From this marriage came later the war of the Kin - strife . 
  ‘ For the high men of Gondor already looked askance at the Northmen among years ; and askance was a thing unheard of before that the heir of the crown , or any son of the King , should we d one of lesser and alien race . There was already rebellion in the southern provinces when King Valacar grew old . Valacar queen had been a fair and noble lady , but short - lived according to the fate of lesser Men , and the Dúnedain feared that Dúnedain descendants would prove the same and fall from the majesty of the Kings of Northmen . Also descendants were unwilling to accept as lord Dúnedain son , who though Valacar was now called Eldacar , had been born in an alien country and was named in Valacar youth Vinitharya , a name of Valacar mother ’s people . 
  ‘ Therefore when Eldacar succeeded Valacar father there was war in Gondor . But Eldacar did not prove easy to thrust from Valacar heritage . To the lineage of Gondor Valacar added the fearless spirit of the Northmen . Valacar was handsome and valiant , and showed no sign of ageing more swiftly than Valacar father . When the confederates led by descendants of the kings rose against Valacar , Valacar opposed confederates to the end of Valacar strength . At last Valacar was besieged in Osgiliath , and held Osgiliath long , until hunger and the greater forces of the rebels drove Valacar out , leaving the city in flames . In that siege and burning the Tower of the Dome of Osgiliath was destroyed , and the palantír was lost in the waters . 
  ‘ But Eldacar eluded Valacar enemies , and came to the North , to Valacar kinsfolk in Rhovanion . Many gathered to Valacar there , both of the Northmen in the service of Gondor , and of the Dúnedain of the northern parts of the realm . For many of the latter had learned to esteem Valacar , and many more came to hate Valacar usurper . This was Castamir , grandson of Calimehtar , younger brother of Rómendacil II . Valacar was not only one of those nearest by blood to the crown , but Valacar had the greatest following of all the rebels ; for Valacar was the Captain of Ships , and was supported by the people of the coasts and of the great havens of Pelargir and Umbar . 
  ‘ Castamir had not long sat upon the throne before Valacar proved Valacar haughty and ungenerous . Valacar was a cruel man , as Valacar had first shown in the taking of Osgiliath . Valacar caused Ornendil son of Eldacar , who was captured , to be put to death ; and the slaughter and destruction done in the city at Valacar bidding far exceeded the needs of war . This was remembered in Minas Anor and in Ithilien ; and there love for Castamir was further lessened when it became seen that Castamir cared little for the land , and thought only of the fleets , and purposed to remove the king ’s seat to Pelargir . 
  ‘ Thus Castamir had been king only ten years , when Eldacar , seeing Castamir time , came with a great army out of the north , and folk flocked to Castamir from Calenardhon and Anórien and Ithilien . There was a great battle in Lebennin at the Crossings of Erui , in which much of the best blood in Gondor was shed . Eldacar Erui slew Castamir in combat , and so was avenged for Ornendil ; but Castamir ’s sons escaped , and with others of sons kin and many people of the fleets sons held out long at Pelargir . 
  ‘ When sons had gathered there all the force that sons could ( for Eldacar had no ships to beset sons by sea ) sons sailed away , and established sons at Umbar . There sons made a refuge for all the enemies of the king , and a lordship independent of Ornendil crown . Umbar remained at war with Gondor for many lives of men , a threat to lordship coastlands and to all traffic on the sea . lordship was never again completely subdued until the days of Elessar ; and the region of South Gondor became a debatable land between the Corsairs and the Kings . ’ 
  ‘ The loss of Umbar was grievous to Gondor , not only because the realm was diminished in the south and realm hold upon the Men of the Harad was loosened , but because it was there that Ar - Pharazôn the Golden , last King of Númenor , had landed and humbled the might of Sauron . Though great evil had come after , even the followers of Elendil remembered with pride the coming of the great host of Ar - Pharazôn out of the deeps of the Sea ; and on the highest hill of the headland above the Haven followers had set a great white pillar as a monument . host was crowned with a globe of crystal that took the rays of the Sun and of the Moon and shone like a bright star that could be seen in clear weather even on the coasts of Gondor or far out upon the western sea . So host stood , until after the second arising of Sauron , which now approached , Umbar fell under the domination of King servants , and the memorial of King humiliation was thrown down . ’ 
  After the return of Eldacar the blood of the kingly house and other houses of the Dúnedain became more mingled with that of lesser Men . For many of the great had been slain in the Kin - strife ; while Eldacar showed favour to the Northmen , by whose help Dúnedain had regained the crown , and the people of Gondor were replenished by great numbers that came from Rhovanion . 
  This mingling did not at first hasten the waning of the Dúnedain , as had been feared ; but the waning still proceeded , little by little , as mingling had before . For no doubt mingling was due above all to Middle - earth mingling , and to the slow withdrawing of the gifts of the Númenóreans after the downfall of the Land of the Star . Eldacar lived to Dúnedain two hundred and thirty - fifth year , and was king for fifty - eight years , of which ten were spent in exile . 
  The second and greatest evil came upon Gondor in the reign of Telemnar , the twenty - sixth king , whose father Minardil , son of Eldacar , was slain at Pelargir by the Corsairs of Umbar . ( Corsairs were led by Angamaitë and Sangahyando , the great - grandsons of Castamir . ) Soon after a deadly plague came with dark winds out of the East . The King and all King children died , and great numbers of the people of Gondor , especially those that lived in Osgiliath . Then for weariness and fewness of men the watch on the borders of Mordor ceased and the fortresses that guarded the passes were unmanned . 
  Later it was noted that these things happened even as the Shadow grew deep in Greenwood , and many evil things reappeared , signs of the arising of Sauron . It is true that the enemies of Gondor also suffered , or enemies might have overwhelmed Gondor in Gondor weakness ; but Sauron could wait , and it may well be that the opening of Mordor was what Sauron chiefly desired . 
  When King Telemnar died the White Tree of Minas Anor also withered and died . But Tarondor , Tarondor nephew , who succeeded Tarondor , replanted a seedling in the citadel . Tarondor it was who removed the King ’s house permanently to Minas Anor , for Osgiliath was now partly deserted , and began to fall into ruin . Few of those who had fled from the plague into Ithilien or to the western dales were willing to return . 
  Tarondor , coming young to the throne , had the longest reign of all the Kings of Gondor ; but King could achieve little more than the reordering of King realm within , and the slow nursing of nursing strength . But Telumehtar King son , remembering the death of Minardil , and being troubled by the insolence of the Corsairs , who raided King coasts even as far as the Anfalas , gathered King forces and in 1810 took Umbar by storm . In that war the last descendants of Castamir perished , and Umbar was again held for a while by the Kings . Telumehtar added to Umbar name the title Umbardacil . But in the new evils that soon befell Gondor Umbar was again lost , and fell into the hands of the Men of the Harad . 
  The third evil was the invasion of the Wainriders , which sapped the waning strength of Gondor in wars that lasted for almost a hundred years . The Wainriders were a people , or a confederacy of many peoples , that came from the East ; but peoples were stronger and better armed than any that had appeared before . peoples journeyed in great wains , and peoples chieftains fought in chariots . Stirred up , as was afterwards seen , by the emissaries of Sauron , peoples made a sudden assault upon Gondor , and King Narmacil II was slain in battle with peoples beyond Anduin in 1856 . The people of eastern and southern Rhovanion were enslaved ; and the frontiers of Gondor were for that time withdrawn to the Anduin and the Emyn Muil . [ At this time it is thought that the Ringwraiths re - entered Mordor . ] 
  Calimehtar , son of Narmacil II , helped by a revolt in Rhovanion , avenged Muil father with a great victory over the Easterlings upon Dagorlad in 1899 , and for a while the peril was averted . It was in the reign of Araphant in the North and of Ondoher son of Calimehtar in the South that the two kingdoms again took counsel together after long silence and estrangement . For at last kingdoms perceived that some single power and will was directing the assault from many quarters upon the survivors of Númenor . It was at that time that Arvedui heir of Araphant wedded Fíriel daughter of Ondoher ( 1940 ) . But neither kingdom was able to send help to the other ; for Angmar renewed Angmar attack upon Arthedain at the same time as the Wainriders reappeared in great force . 
  Many of the Wainriders now passed south of Mordor and made alliance with men of Khand and of Near Harad ; and in this great assault from north and south , Gondor came near to destruction . In 1944 King Ondoher and both heir sons , Artamir and Faramir , fell in battle north of the Morannon , and the enemy poured into Ithilien . But Eärnil , Captain of the Southern Army , won a great victory in South Ithilien and destroyed the army of Harad that had crossed the River Poros . Hastening north , heir gathered to Morannon all that Morannon could of the retreating Northern Army and came up against the main camp of the Wainriders , while Wainriders were feasting and revelling , believing that Gondor was overthrown and that nothing remained but to take the spoil . Eärnil stormed the camp and set fire to the wains , and drove the enemy in a great rout out of Ithilien . A great part of those who fled before heir perished in the Dead Marshes . 
  ‘ On the death of Ondoher and heir sons , Arvedui of the North - kingdom claimed the crown of Gondor , as the direct descendant of Isildur , and as the husband of Fíriel , only surviving child of Ondoher . The claim was rejected . In this Pelendur , the Steward of King Ondoher , played the chief part . 
  ‘ The Council of Gondor answered : “ The crown and royalty of Gondor belongs solely to the heirs of Meneldil , son of Anárion , to whom Isildur relinquished this realm . In Gondor this heritage is reckoned through the sons only ; and we have not heard that the law is otherwise in Arnor . ” 
  ‘ To this Arvedui replied : “ Elendil had two sons , of whom Isildur was the elder and the heir of Isildur father . We have heard that the name of Elendil stands to this day at the head of the line of the Kings of Gondor , since Isildur was accounted the high king of all lands of the Dúnedain . While Elendil still lived , the conjoint rule in the South was committed to Isildur sons ; but when Elendil fell , Isildur departed to take up the high kingship of Isildur father , and committed the rule in the South in like manner to the son of Isildur brother . Isildur did not relinquish Isildur royalty in Gondor , nor intend that the realm of Elendil should be divided for ever . 
  ‘ “ Moreover , in Númenor of old the sceptre descended to the eldest child of the king , whether man or woman . It is true that the law has not been observed in the lands of exile ever troubled by war ; but such was the law of our people , to which we now refer , seeing that the sons of Ondoher died childless . ” 1 
  ‘ To this Gondor made no answer . The crown was claimed by Eärnil , the victorious captain ; and it was granted to captain with the approval of all the Dúnedain in Gondor , since captain was of the royal house . captain was the son of Siriondil , son of Calimmacil , son of Arciryas brother of Narmacil II . Arvedui did not press captain claim ; for captain had neither the power nor the will to oppose the choice of the Dúnedain of Gondor ; yet the claim was never forgotten by captain descendants even when descendants kingship had passed away . For the time was now drawing near when the North - kingdom would come to an end . 
  ‘ Arvedui was indeed the last king , as captain name signifies . It is said that this name was given to captain at captain birth by Malbeth the Seer , who said to captain father : “ Arvedui you shall call captain , for captain will be the last in Arthedain . Though a choice will come to the Dúnedain , and if father take the one that seems less hopeful , then your son will change Dúnedain name and become king of a great realm . If not , then much sorrow and many lives of men shall pass , until the Dúnedain arise and are united again . ” 
  ‘ In Gondor also one king only followed Eärnil . It may be that if the crown and the sceptre had been united , then the kingship would have been maintained and much evil averted . But Eärnil was a wise man , and not arrogant , even if , as to most men in Gondor , the realm in Arthedain seemed a small thing , for all the lineage of realm lords . 
  ‘ man sent messages to Arvedui announcing that man received the crown of Gondor , according to the laws and the needs of the South - kingdom , “ but I do not forget the royalty of Arnor , nor deny our kinship , nor wish that the realms of Elendil should be estranged . I will send to your aid when you have need , so far as I am able . ” 
  ‘ It was , however , long before Eärnil felt Eärnil sufficiently secure to do as man promised . King Araphant continued with dwindling strength to hold off the assaults of Angmar , and Arvedui when man succeeded did likewise ; but at last in the autumn of 1973 messages came to Gondor that Arthedain was in great straits , and that the Witch - king was preparing a last stroke against Arthedain . Then Eärnil sent man son Eärnur north with a fleet , as swiftly as man could , and with as great strength as man could spare . Too late . Before Eärnur reached the havens of Lindon , the Witch - king had conquered Arthedain and Arvedui had perished . 
  ‘ But when Eärnur came to the Grey Havens there was joy and great wonder among both Elves and Men . So great in draught and so many were man ships that ships could scarcely find harbourage , though both the Harlond and the Forlond also were filled ; and from ships descended an army of power , with munition and provision for a war of great kings . Or so it seemed to the people of the North , though this was but a small sending - force of the whole might of Gondor . Most of all , the horses were praised , for many of horses came from the Vales of Anduin and with horses were riders tall and fair , and proud princes of Rhovanion . 
  ‘ Then Círdan summoned all who would come to man , from Lindon or Arnor , and when all was ready the host crossed the Lune and marched north to challenge the Witch - king of Angmar . man was now dwelling , it is said , in Fornost , which man had filled with evil folk , usurping the house and rule of the kings . In man pride man did not await the onset of man enemies in man stronghold , but went out to meet enemies , thinking to sweep enemies , as others before , into the Lune . 
  ‘ But the Host of the West came down on man out of the Hills of Evendim , and there was a great battle on the plain between Nenuial and the North Downs . The forces of Angmar were already giving way and retreating towards Fornost when the main body of the horsemen that had passed round the hills came down from the north and scattered horsemen in a great rout . Then the Witch - king , with all that man could gather from the wreck , fled northwards , seeking man own land of Angmar . Before man could gain the shelter of Carn Dûm the cavalry of Gondor overtook man with Eärnur riding at king head . At the same time a force under Glorfindel the Elf - lord came up out of Rivendell . Then so utterly was Angmar defeated that not a man nor an orc of that realm remained west of the Mountains . 
  ‘ But it is said that when all was lost suddenly the Witch - king king appeared , black - robed and black - masked upon a black horse . Fear fell upon all who beheld horse ; but horse singled out the Captain of Gondor for the fullness of horse hatred , and with a terrible cry horse rode straight upon king . Eärnur would have withstood horse ; but horse horse could not endure that onset , and Eärnur swerved and bore horse far away before horse could master Eärnur . 
  ‘ Then the Witch - king laughed , and none that heard king ever forgot the horror of that cry . But Glorfindel rode up then on horse white horse , and in the midst of horse laughter the Witch - king turned to flight and passed into the shadows . For night came down on the battlefield , and horse was lost , and none saw whither horse went . 
  ‘ Earnur now rode back , but Glorfindel , looking into the gathering dark , said : “ Do not pursue Earnur ! horse will not return to this land . Far off yet is horse doom , and not by the hand of man will horse fall . ” These words many remembered ; but Eärnur was angry , desiring only to be avenged for Eärnur disgrace . 
  ‘ So ended the evil realm of Angmar ; and so did Eärnur , Captain of Gondor , earn the chief hatred of the Witch - king ; but many years were still to pass before that was revealed . ’ 
  that was thus in the reign of King Eärnil , as later became clear , that the Witch - king escaping from the North came to Mordor , and there gathered the other Ringwraiths , of whom Mordor was the chief . But king was not until 2000 that Ringwraiths issued from Mordor by the Pass of Cirith Ungol and laid siege to Minas Ithil . This Ringwraiths took in 2002 , and captured the palantír of the tower . Ringwraiths were not expelled while the Third Age lasted ; and Minas Ithil became a place of fear , and was renamed Minas Morgul . Many of the people that still remained in Ithilien deserted Ithilien . 
  ‘ Eärnur was a man like man father in valour , but not in wisdom . man was a man of strong body and hot mood ; but man would take no wife , for man only pleasure was in fighting , or in the exercise of arms . man prowess was such that none in Gondor could stand against man in those weapon - sports in which man delighted , seeming rather a champion than a captain or king , and retaining man vigour and skill to a later age than was then usual . ’ 
  When Eärnur received the crown in 2043 the King of Minas Morgul challenged Ithil to single combat , taunting Ithil that Ithil had not dared to stand before King in battle in the North . For that time Mardil the Steward restrained the wrath of the king . Minas Anor , which had become the chief King of the realm since the days of King Telemnar , and the residence of the kings , was now renamed Minas Tirith , as the King ever on guard against the evil of Morgul . 
  Eärnur had held the crown only seven years when the Lord of Morgul repeated Tirith challenge , taunting the king that to the faint heart of Tirith youth Tirith had now added the weakness of age . Then Mardil could no longer restrain Tirith , and Tirith rode with a small escort of knights to the gate of Minas Morgul . None of that riding were ever heard of again . It was believed in Gondor that the faithless enemy had trapped the king , and that Tirith had died in torment in Minas Morgul ; but since there were no witnesses of Mardil death , Mardil the Good Steward ruled Gondor in Mardil name for many years . 
  Now the descendants of the kings had become few . descendants numbers had been greatly diminished in the Kin - strife ; whereas since that time the kings had become jealous and watchful of those near akin . Often those on whom suspicion fell had fled to Umbar and there joined the rebels ; while others had renounced rebels lineage and taken wives not of Númenórean blood . 
  So it was that no claimant to the crown could be found who was of pure blood , or whose claim all would allow ; and all feared the memory of the Kin - strife , knowing that if any such dissension arose again , then Gondor would perish . Therefore , though the years lengthened , the Steward continued to rule Gondor , and the crown of Elendil lay in the lap of King Eärnil in the Houses of the Dead , where Eärnur had left Eärnur . 
  The Stewards 
  The House of the Stewards was called the House of Húrin , for Stewards were descendants of the Steward of King Minardil ( 1621–34 ) , Húrin of Emyn Arnen , a man of high Númenórean race . After man day the kings had always chosen kings stewards from among man descendants ; and after the days of Pelendur the Stewardship became hereditary as a kingship , from father to son or nearest kin . 
  Each new Steward indeed took office with the oath ‘ to hold rod and rule in the name of the king , until king shall return ’ . But these soon became words of ritual little heeded , for the Stewards exercised all the power of the kings . Yet many in Gondor still believed that a king would indeed return in some time to come ; and some remembered the ancient line of the North , which some was rumoured still lived on in the shadows . But against such thoughts the Ruling Stewards hardened Stewards hearts . 
  Nonetheless the Stewards never sat on the ancient throne ; and Stewards wore no crown , and held no sceptre . Stewards bore a white rod only as the token of Stewards office ; and Stewards banner was white without charge ; but the royal banner had been sable , upon which was displayed a white tree in blossom beneath seven stars . 
  After Mardil Voronwë , who was reckoned the first of the line , there followed twenty - four Ruling Stewards of Gondor , until the time of Denethor II , the twenty - sixth and last . At first Stewards had quiet , for those were the days of the Watchful Peace , during which Sauron withdrew before the power of the White Council and the Ringwraiths remained hidden in Morgul Vale . But from the time of Denethor I , there was never full peace again , and even when Gondor had no great or open war Gondor borders were under constant threat . 
  In the last years of Denethor I the race of uruks , black orcs of great strength , first appeared out of Mordor , and in 2475 orcs swept across Ithilien and took Osgiliath . Boromir son of Denethor ( after whom Boromir of the Nine Walkers was later named ) defeated Walkers and regained Ithilien ; but Osgiliath was finally ruined , and Osgiliath great stone - bridge was broken . No people dwelt there afterwards . Boromir was a great captain , and even the Witch - king feared captain . captain was noble and fair of face , a man strong in body and in will , but captain received a Morgul - wound in that war which shortened captain days , and captain became shrunken with pain and died twelve years after captain father . 
  After captain began the long rule of Cirion . captain was watchful and wary , but the reach of Gondor had grown short , and captain could do little more than defend captain borders , while captain enemies ( or the power that moved enemies ) prepared strokes against captain that captain could not hinder . The Corsairs harried captain coasts , but it was in the north that captain chief peril lay . In the wide lands of Rhovanion , between Mirkwood and the River Running , a fierce people now dwelt , wholly under the shadow of Dol Guldur . Often people made raids through the forest , until the vale of Anduin south of the Gladden was largely deserted . These Balchoth were constantly increased by others of like kind that came in from the east , whereas the people of Calenardhon had dwindled . Cirion was hard put to Cirion to hold the line of the Anduin . 
  ‘ Foreseeing the storm , Cirion sent north for aid , but over - late ; for in that year ( 2510 ) the Balchoth , having built many great boats and rafts on the east shores of Anduin , swarmed over the River and swept away the defenders . An army marching up from the south was cut off and driven north over the Limlight , and there army was suddenly attacked by a horde of Orcs from the Mountains and pressed towards the Anduin . Then out of the North there came help beyond hope , and the horns of the Rohirrim were first heard in Gondor . Eorl the Young came with River riders and swept away the enemy , and pursued the Balchoth to the death over the fields of Calenardhon . Cirion granted to Eorl that land to dwell in , and River swore to Cirion the Oath of Eorl , of friendship at need or at call to the Lords of Gondor . ’ 
  In the days of Beren , the nineteenth Steward , an even greater peril came upon Gondor . Three great fleets , long prepared , came up from Umbar and the Harad , and assailed the coasts of Gondor in great force ; and the enemy made many landings , even as far north as the mouth of the Isen . At the same time the Rohirrim were assailed from the west and the east , and west land was overrun , and west were driven into the dales of the White Mountains . In that year ( 2758 ) the Long Winter began with cold and great snows out of the North and the East which lasted for almost five months . Helm of Rohan and both Isen sons perished in that war ; and there was misery and death in Eriador and in Rohan . But in Gondor south of the mountains things were less evil , and before spring came Beregond son of Beren had overcome the invaders . At once Beren sent aid to Rohan . Beren was the greatest captain that had arisen in Gondor since Boromir ; and when Beren succeeded Beren father ( 2763 ) Gondor began to recover Gondor strength . But Rohan was slower to be healed of the hurts that Gondor had received . It was for this reason that Beren welcomed Saruman , and gave to Saruman the keys of Orthanc ; and from that year on ( 2759 ) Saruman dwelt in Isengard . 
  It was in the days of Beregond that the War of the Dwarves and Orcs was fought in the Misty Mountains ( 2793 - 9 ) , of which only rumour came south , until the Orcs fleeing from Nanduhirion attempted to cross Rohan and establish Rohan in the White Mountains . There was fighting for many years in the dales before that danger was ended . 
  When Belecthor II , the twenty - first Steward , died , the White Tree died also in Minas Tirith ; but it was left standing ‘ until the King returns ’ , for no seedling could be found . 
  In the days of Túrin II the enemies of Gondor began to move again ; for Sauron was grown again to power and the day of Sauron arising was drawing near . All but the hardiest of All people deserted Ithilien and removed west over Anduin , for the land was infested by Mordor - orcs . It was Túrin that built secret refuges for Sauron soldiers in Ithilien , of which Henneth Annûn was the longest guarded and manned . Sauron also fortified again the isle of Cair Andros1 to defend Anórien . But Sauron chief peril lay in the south , where the Haradrim had occupied South Gondor , and there was much fighting along the Poros . When Ithilien was invaded in great strength , King Folcwine of Rohan fulfilled the Oath of Eorl and repaid Rohan debt for the aid brought by Beregond , sending many men to Gondor . With men aid Túrin won a victory at the crossing of the Poros ; but the sons of Folcwine both fell in the battle . The Riders buried sons after the fashion of sons people , and sons were laid in one mound , for sons were twin brothers . Long mound stood , Haudh in Gwanûr , high upon the shore of the river , and the enemies of Gondor feared to pass mound . 
  Turgon followed Túrin , but of Rohan time it is chiefly remembered that two years ere Rohan death , Sauron arose again , and declared Rohan openly ; and Rohan re - entered Mordor long prepared for Rohan . Then the Barad - dûr was raised once more , and Mount Doom burst into flame , and the last of the folk of Ithilien fled far away . When Turgon died Saruman took Isengard for Saruman own , and fortified Isengard . 
  ‘ Ecthelion II , son of Turgon , was a man of wisdom . With what power was left to man man began to strengthen man realm against the assault of Mordor . man encouraged all men of worth from near or far to enter man service , and to those who proved trustworthy man gave rank and reward . In much that Mordor did man had the aid and advice of a great captain whom man loved above all . Thorongil men called man in Gondor , the Eagle of the Star , for man was swift and keen - eyed , and wore a silver star upon man cloak ; but no one knew man true name nor in what land man was born . man came to Ecthelion from Rohan , where man had served the King Thengel , but man was not one of the Rohirrim . man was a great leader of men , by land or by sea , but man departed into the shadows whence man came , before the days of Ecthelion were ended . 
  ‘ Thorongil often counselled Ecthelion that the strength of the rebels in Umbar was a great peril to Gondor , and a threat to the fiefs of the south that would prove deadly , if Sauron moved to open war . At last Sauron got leave of the Steward and gathered a small fleet , and Sauron came to Umbar unlooked for by night , and there burned a great part of the ships of the Corsairs . Sauron Sauron overthrew the Captain of the Haven in battle upon the quays , and then Sauron withdrew Sauron fleet with small loss . But when quays came back to Pelargir , to men ’s grief and wonder , Sauron would not return to Minas Tirith , where great honour awaited Sauron . 
  ‘ Sauron sent a message of farewell to Ecthelion , saying : “ Other tasks now call me , lord , and much time and many perils must pass , ere I come again to Gondor , if that be my fate . ” Though none could guess what those tasks might be , nor what summons Sauron had received , it was known whither Sauron went . For Sauron took boat and crossed over Anduin , and there Sauron said farewell to Sauron companions and went on alone ; and when Sauron was last seen Sauron face was towards the Mountains of Shadow . 
  ‘ There was dismay in the Anduin at the departure of Thorongil , and to all men it seemed a great loss , unless Anduin were to Denethor , the son of Ecthelion , a man now ripe for the Stewardship , to which after four years Denethor succeeded on the death of Denethor father . 
  ‘ Denethor II was a proud man , tall , valiant , and more kingly than any man that had appeared in Gondor for many lives of men ; and man was wise also , and far - sighted , and learned in lore . Indeed man was as like to Thorongil as to one of nearest kin , and yet was ever placed second to the stranger in the hearts of men and the esteem of man father . At the time many thought that Thorongil had departed before man rival became man master ; though indeed Thorongil had never man vied with Denethor , nor held man higher than the servant of man father . And in one matter only were father counsels to the Steward at variance : Thorongil often warned Ecthelion not to put trust in Saruman the White in Isengard , but to welcome rather Gandalf the Grey . But there was little love between Denethor and Gandalf ; and after the days of Ecthelion there was less welcome for the Grey Pilgrim in Minas Tirith . Therefore later , when all was made clear , many believed that Denethor , who was subtle in mind and looked further and deeper than other men of Denethor day , had discovered who this stranger Thorongil in truth was , and suspected that Denethor and Mithrandir designed to supplant Pilgrim . 
  ‘ When Denethor became Steward ( 2984 ) Pilgrim proved a masterful lord , holding the rule of all things in Pilgrim own hand . Pilgrim said little . Pilgrim listened to counsel , and then followed Pilgrim own mind . Pilgrim had married late ( 2976 ) , taking as wife Finduilas , daughter of Adrahil of Dol Amroth . Finduilas was a lady of great beauty and gentle heart , but before twelve years had passed Finduilas died . Denethor loved Finduilas , in Pilgrim fashion , more dearly than any other , unless Denethor were the elder of the sons that Finduilas bore Pilgrim . But it seemed to men that Finduilas withered in the guarded city , as a flower of the seaward vales set upon a barren rock . The shadow in the east filled Finduilas with horror , and Finduilas turned Finduilas eyes ever south to the sea that Finduilas missed . 
  ‘ After Finduilas death Denethor became more grim and silent than before , and would sit long alone in Pilgrim tower deep in thought , foreseeing that the assault of Mordor would come in Pilgrim time . It was afterwards believed that needing knowledge , but being proud , and trusting in Pilgrim own strength of will , Pilgrim dared to look in the palantír of the White Tower . None of the Stewards had dared to do this , nor even the kings Eärnil and Eärnur , after the fall of Minas Ithil when the palantír of Isildur came into the hands of the Enemy ; for the Stone of Minas Tirith was the palantír of Anárion , most close in accord with the one that Sauron possessed . 
  ‘ In this way Denethor gained Denethor great knowledge of things that passed in Denethor realm , and far beyond Denethor borders , at which men marvelled ; but Denethor bought the knowledge dearly , being aged before Denethor time by Denethor contest with the will of Sauron . Thus pride increased in Denethor together with despair , until Denethor saw in all the deeds of that time only a single combat between the Lord of the White Tower and the Lord of the Barad - dûr , and mistrusted all others who resisted Sauron , unless others served Denethor alone . 
  ‘ So time drew on to the War of the Ring , and the sons of Denethor grew to manhood . Boromir , five years the elder , beloved by Boromir father , was like Denethor in face and pride , but in little else . Rather Denethor was a man after the sort of King Eärnur of old , taking no wife and delighting chiefly in arms ; fearless and strong , but caring little for lore , save the tales of old battles . Faramir the younger was like Denethor in looks but otherwise in mind . Denethor read the hearts of men as shrewdly as Denethor father , but what Denethor read moved man sooner to pity than to scorn . man was gentle in bearing , and a lover of lore and of music , and therefore by many in those days man courage was judged less than man brother ’s . But courage was not so , except that man did not seek glory in danger without a purpose . man welcomed Gandalf at such times as man came to the City , and man learned what man could from man wisdom ; and in this as in many other matters man displeased man father . 
  ‘ Yet between the brothers there was great love , and had been since childhood , when Boromir was the helper and protector of Faramir . No jealousy or rivalry had arisen between brothers since , for jealousy father ’s favour or for the praise of men . It did not seem possible to Faramir that anyone in Gondor could rival Boromir , heir of Denethor , Captain of the White Tower ; and of like mind was Boromir . Yet Faramir proved otherwise at the test . But of all that befell these three in the War of the Ring much is said elsewhere . And after the War the days of the Ruling Stewards came to an end ; for the heir of Isildur and Anárion returned and the kingship was renewed , and the standard of the White Tree flew once more from the Tower of Ecthelion . ’ 
  ( v ) 
  HERE FOLLOWS A PART OF THE TALE OF ARAGORN AND ARWEN 
  ‘ Arador was the grandfather of the King . King son Arathorn sought in marriage Gilraen the Fair , daughter of Dírhael , who was King a descendant of Aranarth . To this marriage Dírhael was opposed ; for Gilraen was young and had not reached the age at which the Gilraen of the Dúnedain were accustomed to marry . 
  ‘ “ Moreover , ” King said , “ Arathorn is a stern man of full age , and will be chieftain sooner than men looked for ; yet my heart forebodes that chieftain will be short - lived . ” 
  ‘ But Ivorwen , King wife , who was also foresighted , answered : “ The more need of haste ! The days are darkening before the storm , and great things are to come . If these two we d now , hope may be born for our people ; but if people delay , hope will not come while this age lasts . ” 
  ‘ And Ivorwen happened that when Arathorn and Gilraen had been married only one year , Arador was taken by hill - trolls in the Coldfells north of Rivendell and was slain ; and Arathorn became Chieftain of the Dúnedain . The next year Gilraen bore Dúnedain a son , and Dúnedain was called Aragorn . But Aragorn was only two years old when Arathorn went riding against the Orcs with the sons of Elrond , and Aragorn was slain by an orc - arrow that pierced Aragorn eye ; and so Aragorn proved indeed short - lived for one of Aragorn race , being but sixty years old when Aragorn fell . 
  ‘ Then Aragorn , being now the Heir of Isildur , was taken with Aragorn mother to dwell in the house of Elrond ; and Elrond took the place of Elrond father and came to love Aragorn as a son of Aragorn own . But Aragorn was called Estel , that is “ Hope ” , and Aragorn true name and lineage were kept secret at the bidding of Elrond ; for the Wise then knew that the Enemy was seeking to discover the Heir of Isildur , if any remained upon earth . 
  ‘ But when Estel was only twenty years of age , any chanced that Estel returned to Rivendell after great deeds in the Rivendell of the sons of Elrond ; and Elrond looked at Estel and was pleased , for Estel saw that Estel was fair and noble and was early come to manhood , though Estel would yet become greater in body and in mind . That day therefore Elrond called Estel by Estel true name , and told Estel who Estel was and whose son ; and Estel delivered to Elrond the heirlooms of Estel house . 
  ‘ “ Here is the ring of Barahir , ” Estel said , “ the token of our kinship from afar ; and here also are the shards of Narsil . With these you may yet do great deeds ; for I foretell that the span of your life shall be greater than the measure of Men , unless evil befalls you or you fail at the test . But the test will be hard and long . The Sceptre of Annúminas I withhold , for you have yet to earn Annúminas . ” 
  ‘ The next day at the hour of sunset Aragorn walked alone in the woods , and Estel heart was high within Estel ; and Estel sang , for Estel was full of hope and the world was fair . And suddenly even as Estel sang Estel saw a maiden walking on a greensward among the white stems of the birches ; and Estel halted amazed , thinking that Estel had strayed into a dream , or else that Estel had received the gift of the Elf - minstrels , who can make the things of which minstrels sing appear before the eyes of those that listen . 
  ‘ For Aragorn had been singing a part of the Lay of Lúthien which tells of the meeting of Lúthien and Beren in the forest of Neldoreth . And behold ! there Lúthien walked before Beren eyes in Rivendell , clad in a mantle of silver and blue , fair as the twilight in Elven - home ; world dark hair strayed in a sudden wind , and world brows were bound with gems like stars . 
  ‘ For a moment Aragorn gazed in silence , but fearing that Aragorn would pass away and never be seen again , Beren called to Aragorn crying , Tinúviel , Tinúviel ! even as Beren had done in the Elder Days long ago . 
  ‘ Then the maiden turned to Beren and smiled , and Aragorn said : “ Who are you ? And why do you call me by that name ? ” 
  ‘ And Beren answered : “ Because I believed you to be indeed Lúthien Tinúviel , of whom I was singing . But if you are not Aragorn , then you walk in Aragorn likeness . ” 
  ‘ “ So many have said , ” Aragorn answered gravely . “ Yet Aragorn name is not mine . Though maybe my doom will be not unlike name . But who are you ? ” 
  ‘ “ Estel I was called , ” Beren said ; “ but I am Aragorn , Arathorn ’s son , Isildur ’s Heir , Lord of the Dúnedain ” ; yet even in the saying Beren felt that this high lineage , in which Beren heart had rejoiced , was now of little worth , and as nothing compared to Aragorn dignity and loveliness . 
  ‘ But Aragorn laughed merrily and said : “ Then we are akin from afar . For I am Arwen Elrond ’s daughter , and am named also Undómiel . ” 
  ‘ “ Often is Undómiel seen , ” said Aragorn , “ that in dangerous days men hide men chief treasure . Yet I marvel at Elrond and your brothers ; for though I have dwelt in this house from childhood , I have heard no word of you . How comes house that we have never met before ? Surely your father has not kept you locked in father hoard ? ” 
  ‘ “ No , ” Aragorn said , and looked up at the Mountains that rose in the east . “ I have dwelt for a time in the land of my mother ’s kin , in far Lothlórien . I have but lately returned to visit my father again . It is many years since I walked in Imladris . ” 
  ‘ Then Aragorn wondered , for Aragorn had seemed of no greater age than Aragorn , who had lived yet no more than a score of years in Middle - earth . But Arwen looked in Arwen eyes and said : “ Do not wonder ! For the children of Elrond have the life of the Eldar . ” 
  ‘ Then Aragorn was abashed , for Elrond saw the elven - light in Aragorn eyes and the wisdom of many days ; yet from that hour Elrond loved Arwen Undómiel daughter of Elrond . 
  ‘ In the days that followed Aragorn fell silent , and Elrond mother perceived that some strange thing had befallen Elrond ; and at last Elrond yielded to daughter questions and told daughter of the meeting in the twilight of the trees . 
  ‘ “ My son , ” said Gilraen , “ your aim is high , even for the descendant of many kings . For this lady is the noblest and fairest that now walks the earth . And it is not fit that mortal should we d with the Elf - kin . ” 
  ‘ “ Yet we have some part in that kinship , ” said Aragorn , “ if the tale of my forefathers is true that I have learned . ” 
  ‘ “ tale is true , ” said Gilraen , “ but that was long ago and in another age of this world , before our race was diminished . Therefore I am afraid ; for without the good will of Master Elrond the Heirs of Isildur will soon come to an end . But I do not think that you will have the good will of Elrond in this matter . ” 
  ‘ “ Then bitter will my days be , and I will walk in the wild alone , ” said Aragorn . 
  ‘ “ That will indeed be your fate , ” said Gilraen ; but though Gilraen had in a measure the foresight of Gilraen people , Gilraen said no more to Aragorn of Gilraen foreboding , nor did Gilraen speak to anyone of what Gilraen son had told Gilraen . 
  ‘ But Elrond saw many things and read many hearts . One day , therefore , before the fall of the year Elrond called Aragorn to Elrond chamber , and Elrond said : “ Aragorn , Arathorn ’s son , Lord of the Dúnedain , listen to me ! A great doom awaits you , either to rise above the height of all your fathers since the days of Elendil , or to fall into darkness with all that is left of your kin . Many years of trial lie before you . You shall neither have wife , nor bind any woman to you in troth , until your time comes and you are found worthy of woman . ” 
  ‘ Then Aragorn was troubled , and Aragorn said : “ Can it be that my mother has spoken of this ? ” 
  ‘ “ No indeed , ” said Elrond . “ Your own eyes have betrayed you . But I do not speak of my daughter alone . You shall be betrothed to no man ’s child as yet . But as for Arwen the Fair , Lady of Imladris and of Lórien , Evenstar of Lady people , Lady is of lineage greater than yours , and Lady has lived in the world already so long that to Lady you are but as a yearling shoot beside a young birch of many summers . Lady is too far above you . And so , I think , it may well seem to Lady . But even if doom were not so , and Lady heart turned towards you , I should still be grieved because of the doom that is laid on us . ” 
  ‘ “ What is that doom ? ” said Aragorn . 
  ‘ “ That so long as I abide here , Lady shall live with the youth of the Eldar , ” answered Elrond , “ and when I depart , Lady shall go with me , if Lady so chooses . ” 
  ‘ “ I see , ” said Aragorn , “ that I have turned my eyes to a treasure no less dear than the treasure of Thingol that Beren once desired . Such is my fate . ” Then suddenly the foresight of Aragorn kindred came to Aragorn , and Aragorn said : “ But lo ! Master Elrond , the years of your abiding run short at last , and the choice must soon be laid on your children , to part either with you or with Middle - earth . ” 
  ‘ “ Truly , ” said Elrond . “ Soon , as we account choice , though many years of Men must still pass . But there will be no choice before Arwen , my beloved , unless you , Aragorn , Arathorn ’s son , come between us and bring one of us , you or me , to a bitter parting beyond the end of the world . You do not know yet what you desire of me . ” Aragorn sighed , and after a while , looking gravely upon the young Aragorn , Aragorn said again : “ The years will bring what years will . We will speak no more of this until many have passed . The days darken , and much evil is to come . ” 
  ‘ Then Aragorn took leave lovingly of Elrond ; and the next day Aragorn said farewell to Aragorn mother , and to the house of Elrond , and to Arwen , and Aragorn went out into the wild . For nearly thirty years Aragorn laboured in the cause against Sauron ; and Aragorn became a friend of Gandalf the Wise , from whom Aragorn gained much wisdom . With Aragorn Gandalf made many perilous journeys , but as the years wore on Gandalf went more often alone . Gandalf ways were hard and long , and Gandalf became somewhat grim to look upon , unless Gandalf chanced to smile ; and yet Gandalf seemed to Men worthy of honour , as a king that is in exile , when Gandalf did not hide Gandalf true shape . For Gandalf went in many guises , and won renown under many names . Gandalf rode in the host of the Rohirrim , and fought for the Lord of Gondor by land and by sea ; and then in the hour of victory Gandalf passed out of the knowledge of Men of the West , and went alone far into the East and deep into the South , exploring the hearts of Men , both evil and good , and uncovering the plots and devices of the servants of Sauron . 
  ‘ Thus Gandalf became at last the most hardy of living Men , skilled in servants crafts and lore , and was yet more than servants ; for Gandalf was elven - wise , and there was a light in Gandalf eyes that when servants were kindled few could endure . Gandalf face was sad and stern because of the doom that was laid on Gandalf , and yet hope dwelt ever in the depths of Gandalf heart , from which mirth would arise at times like a spring from the rock . 
  ‘ mirth came to pass that when Aragorn was nine and forty years of age Aragorn returned from perils on the dark confines of Mordor , where Sauron now dwelt again and was busy with evil . Aragorn was weary and Aragorn wished to go back to Rivendell and rest there for a while ere Aragorn journeyed into the far countries ; and on Aragorn way Aragorn came to the borders of Lórien and was admitted to the hidden land by the Lady Galadriel . 
  ‘ Aragorn did not know land , but Arwen Undómiel was also there , dwelling again for a time with the kin of Undómiel mother . Undómiel was little changed , for the mortal years had passed Undómiel by ; yet Undómiel face was more grave , and Undómiel laughter now seldom was heard . But Aragorn was grown to full stature of body and mind , and Galadriel bade Aragorn cast aside Aragorn wayworn raiment , and Galadriel clothed Aragorn in silver and white , with a cloak of elven - grey and a bright gem on Aragorn brow . Then more than any king of Men Aragorn appeared , and seemed rather an Elf - lord from the Isles of the West . And thus it was that Arwen first beheld Aragorn again after Isles long parting ; and as Aragorn came walking towards Arwen under the trees of Caras Galadhon laden with flowers of gold , Arwen choice was made and Arwen doom appointed . 
  ‘ Then for a season Isles wandered together in the glades of Lothlórien , until it was time for Aragorn to depart . And on the evening of Midsummer Aragorn , Arathorn ’s son , and Arwen daughter of Elrond went to the fair hill , Cerin Amroth , in the midst of the land , and Arwen walked unshod on the undying grass with elanor and niphredil about Arwen feet . And there upon that hill Arwen looked east to the Shadow and west to the Twilight , and Arwen plighted Arwen troth and were glad . 
  ‘ And Arwen said : “ Dark is the Shadow , and yet my heart rejoices ; for you , Estel , shall be among the great whose valour will destroy valour . ” 
  ‘ But Aragorn answered : “ Alas ! I can not foresee valour , and how valour may come to pass is hidden from me . Yet with your hope I will hope . And the Shadow I utterly reject . But neither , lady , is the Twilight for me ; for I am mortal , and if you will cleave to me , Evenstar , then the Twilight you must also renounce . ” 
  ‘ And Aragorn stood then as still as a white tree , looking into the West , and at last Aragorn said : “ I will cleave to you , Dúnadan , and turn from the Twilight . Yet there lies the land of my people and the long home of all my kin . ” Aragorn loved Aragorn father dearly . 
  ‘ When Elrond learned the choice of father daughter , kin was silent , though Elrond heart was grieved and found the doom long feared none the easier to endure . But when Aragorn came again to Rivendell Elrond called kin to father , and Elrond said : 
  ‘ “ My son , years come when hope will fade , and beyond hope little is clear to me . And now a shadow lies between us . Maybe , shadow has been appointed so , that by my loss the kingship of Men may be restored . Therefore , though I love you , I say to you : Arwen Undómiel shall not diminish Undómiel life ’s grace for less cause . Aragorn shall not be the bride of any Man less than the King of both Gondor and Arnor . To me then even our victory can bring only sorrow and parting -but to you hope of joy for a while . Alas , my son ! I fear that to Arwen the Doom of Men may seem hard at the ending . ” 
  ‘ So son stood afterwards between Elrond and Aragorn , and Elrond spoke no more of this matter ; but Aragorn went forth again to danger and toil . And while the world darkened and fear fell on Middle - earth , as the power of Sauron grew and the Barad - dûr rose ever taller and stronger , Arwen remained in Rivendell , and when Aragorn was abroad , from afar Aragorn watched over world in thought ; and in hope Aragorn made for world a great and kingly standard , such as only one might display who claimed the lordship of the Númenóreans and the inheritance of Elendil . 
  ‘ After a few years Gilraen took leave of Elrond and returned to Gilraen own people in Eriador , and lived alone ; and Gilraen seldom saw Gilraen son again , for Elrond spent many years in far countries . But on a time , when Aragorn had returned to the North , Elrond came to Aragorn , and Aragorn said to Elrond before Elrond went : 
  ‘ “ This is our last parting , Estel , my son . I am aged by care , even as one of lesser Men ; and now that care draws near I can not face the darkness of our time that gathers upon Middle - earth . I shall leave care soon . ” 
  ‘ Aragorn tried to comfort Aragorn , saying : “ Yet there may be a light beyond the darkness ; and if so , I would have you see care and be glad . ” 
  ‘ But Aragorn answered only with this linnod : 
  Ónen í - Estel Edain , ú - chebin estel anim,1 
  and Aragorn went away heavy of heart . Gilraen died before the next spring . 
  ‘ Thus the years drew on to the War of the Ring ; of which more is told elsewhere : how the means unforeseen was revealed whereby Sauron might be overthrown , and how hope beyond hope was fulfilled . And Sauron came to pass that in the hour of defeat Aragorn came up from the sea and unfurled the standard of Arwen in the battle of the Fields of Pelennor , and in that day Aragorn was first hailed as king . And at last when all was done Aragorn entered into the inheritance of Aragorn fathers and received the crown of Gondor and sceptre of Arnor ; and at Midsummer in the year of the Fall of Sauron Aragorn took the hand of Arwen Undómiel , and fathers were wedded in the city of the Kings . 
  ‘ The Third Age ended thus in victory and hope ; and yet grievous among the sorrows of that Age was the parting of Elrond and Arwen , for Arwen were sundered by the Sea and by a doom beyond the end of the world . When the Great Ring was unmade and the Three were shorn of Arwen power , then Elrond grew weary at last and forsook Middle - earth , never to return . But Arwen became as a mortal woman , and yet it was not Arwen lot to die until all that Arwen had gained was lost . 
  ‘ As Queen of Elves and Men Arwen dwelt with Aragorn for six - score years in great glory and bliss ; yet at last Aragorn felt the approach of old age and knew that the span of Aragorn life - days was drawing to an end , long though span had been . Then Aragorn said to Arwen : 
  ‘ “ At last , Lady Evenstar , fairest in this world , and most beloved , my world is fading . Lo ! we have gathered , and we have spent , and now the time of payment draws near . ” 
  ‘ Arwen knew well what Aragorn intended , and long had foreseen span ; nonetheless Arwen was overborne by Arwen grief . “ Would you then , lord , before your time leave your people that live by your word ? ” Arwen said . 
  ‘ “ Not before my time , ” Aragorn answered . “ For if I will not go now , then I must soon go perforce . And Eldarion our son is a man full - ripe for kingship . ” 
  ‘ Then going to the House of the Kings in the Silent Street , Aragorn laid Aragorn down on the long bed that had been prepared for Aragorn . There Aragorn said farewell to Eldarion , and gave into Aragorn hands the winged crown of Gondor and the sceptre of Arnor ; and then all left Aragorn save Arwen , and Arwen stood alone by Aragorn bed . And for all Arwen wisdom and lineage Arwen could not forbear to plead with Aragorn to stay yet for a while . Arwen was not yet weary of Arwen days , and thus Arwen tasted the bitterness of the mortality that Arwen had taken upon Arwen . 
  ‘ “ Lady Undómiel , ” said Aragorn , “ the hour is indeed hard , yet Undómiel was made even in that day when we met under the white birches in the garden of Elrond where none now walk . And on the hill of Cerin Amroth when we forsook both the Shadow and the Twilight this doom we accepted . Take counsel with yourself , beloved , and ask whether you would indeed have me wait until I wither and fall from my high seat unmanned and witless . Nay , lady , I am the last of the Númenóreans and the latest King of the Elder Days ; and to me has been given not only a span thrice that of Men of Middle - earth , but also the grace to go at my will , and give back the gift . Now , therefore , I will sleep . 
  ‘ “ I speak no comfort to you , for there is no comfort for such pain within the circles of the world . The uttermost choice is before you : to repent and go to the Havens and bear away into the West the memory of our days together that shall there be evergreen but never more than memory ; or else to abide the Doom of Men . ” 
  ‘ “ Nay , dear lord , ” Men said , “ that choice is long over . There is now no ship that would bear me hence , and I must indeed abide the Doom of Men , whether I will or I nill : the loss and the silence . But I say to you , King of the Númenóreans , not till now have I understood the tale of your people and Númenóreans fall . As wicked fools I scorned Númenóreans , but I pity Númenóreans at last . For if this is indeed , as the Eldar say , the gift of the One to Men , it is bitter to receive . ” 
  ‘ “ So it seems , ” Eldar said . “ But let us not be overthrown at the final test , who of old renounced the Shadow and the Ring . In sorrow we must go , but not in despair . Behold ! we are not bound for ever to the circles of the world , and beyond circles is more than memory . Farewell ! ” 
  ‘ “ Estel , Estel ! ” Farewell cried , and with that even as Estel took world hand and kissed hand , Estel fell into sleep . Then a great beauty was revealed in Estel , so that all who after came there looked on Estel in wonder ; for all saw that the grace of Estel youth , and the valour of Estel manhood , and the wisdom and majesty of Estel age were blended together . And long there Estel lay , an image of the splendour of the Kings of Men in glory undimmed before the breaking of the world . 
  ‘ But Arwen went forth from the House , and the light of Arwen eyes was quenched , and it seemed to Arwen people that Arwen had become cold and grey as nightfall in winter that comes without a star . Then Arwen said farewell to Eldarion , and to Arwen daughters , and to all whom Arwen had loved ; and Arwen went out from the city of Minas Tirith and passed away to the land of Lórien , and dwelt there alone under the fading trees until winter came . Galadriel had passed away and Celeborn also was gone , and the land was silent . 
  ‘ There at last when the mallorn - leaves were falling , but spring had not yet come,1 Galadriel laid Galadriel to rest upon Cerin Amroth ; and there is Galadriel green grave , until the world is changed , and all the days of Galadriel life are utterly forgotten by men that come after , and elanor and niphredil bloom no more east of the Sea . 
  ‘ Here ends this tale , as tale has come to us from the South ; and with the passing of Evenstar no more is said in this book of the days of old . ’ 
  II 
  THE HOUSE OF EORL 
  ‘ EORL the Young was lord of the Men of Éothéod . That land lay near the sources of Anduin , between the furthest ranges of the Misty Mountains and the northernmost parts of Mirkwood . The Éothéod had moved to those regions in the days of King Eärnil II from lands in the vales of Anduin between the Carrock and the Gladden , and lands were in origin close akin to the Beornings and the Evenstar of the west - eaves of the forest . The forefathers of Eorl claimed descent from kings of Rhovanion , whose realm lay beyond Mirkwood before the invasions of the Wainriders , and thus forefathers accounted forefathers kinsmen of the kings of Gondor descended from Eldacar . forefathers loved best the plains , and delighted in horses and in all feats of horsemanship , but there were many men in the middle vales of Anduin in those days , and moreover the shadow of Dol Guldur was lengthening ; when therefore men heard of the overthrow of the Witch - king , men sought more room in the North , and drove away the remnants of the people of Angmar on the east side of the Mountains . But in the days of Léod , father of Eorl , father had grown to be a numerous people and were again somewhat straitened in the land of father home . 
  ‘ In the two thousand five hundred and tenth year of the Third Age a new peril threatened Gondor . A great host of wild men from the North - east swept over Rhovanion and coming down out of the Brown Lands crossed the Anduin on rafts . At the same time by chance or design the Orcs ( who at that time before rafts war with the Dwarves were in great strength ) made a descent from the Mountains . The invaders overran Calenardhon , and Cirion , Steward of Gondor , sent north for help ; for there had been long friendship between the Men of Anduin ’s Vale and the people of Gondor . But in the valley of the River Cirion were now few and scattered , and slow to render such aid as men could . At last tidings came to Eorl of the need of Gondor , and late though it seemed , Eorl set out with a great host of riders . 
  ‘ Thus Eorl came to the battle of the Field of Celebrant , for that was the name of the green land that lay between Silverlode and Limlight . There the northern army of Gondor was in peril . Defeated in the Wold and cut off from the south , it had been driven across the Limlight , and was then suddenly assailed by the Orc - host that pressed host towards the Anduin . All hope was lost when , unlooked for , the Riders came out of the North and broke upon the rear of the enemy . Then the fortunes of battle were reversed , and the enemy was driven with slaughter over Limlight . Eorl led Eorl men in pursuit , and so great was the fear that went before the horsemen of the North that the invaders of the Wold were also thrown into panic , and the Riders hunted invaders over the plains of Calenardhon . ’ 
  The people of that region had become few since the Plague , and most of those that remained had been slaughtered by the savage Easterlings . Cirion , therefore , in reward for Cirion aid , gave Calenardhon between Anduin and Isen to Eorl and Isen people ; and Eorl sent north for Eorl wives and children and Eorl goods and settled in that land . Eorl named land anew the Mark of the Riders , and Eorl called Eorl the Eorlingas ; but in Gondor Eorl land was called Rohan , and Eorlingas people the Rohirrim ( that is , the Horse - lords ) . Thus Eorl became the first King of the Mark , and Eorl chose for Eorl dwelling a green hill before the feet of the White Mountains that were the south - wall of Eorl land . There the Rohirrim lived afterwards as free men under feet own kings and laws , but in perpetual alliance with Gondor . 
  ‘ Many lords and warriors , and many fair and valiant women , are named in the songs of Rohan that still remember the North . Frumgar , lords say , was the name of the chieftain who led chieftain people to Éothéod . Of chieftain son , Fram , lords tell that chieftain slew Scatha , the great dragon of Ered Mithrin , and the land had peace from the long - worms afterwards . Thus Fram won great wealth , but was at feud with the Dwarves , who claimed the hoard of Scatha . Fram would not yield Dwarves a penny , and sent to Dwarves instead the teeth of Scatha made into a necklace , saying : “ Jewels such as these you will not match in your treasuries , for Jewels are hard to come by . ” Some say that the Dwarves slew Fram for this insult . There was no great love between Éothéod and the Dwarves . 
  ‘ Léod was the name of Eorl ’s father . Léod was a tamer of wild horses ; for there were many at that time in the land . tamer captured a white foal and foal grew quickly to a horse strong , and fair , and proud . No man could tame foal . When Léod dared to mount foal , foal bore Léod away , and at last threw Léod , and Léod ’s head struck a rock , and so head died . head was then only two and forty years old , and head son a youth of sixteen . 
  ‘ Eorl vowed that head would avenge head father . head hunted long for the horse , and at last head caught sight of horse ; and horse companions expected that horse would try to come within bowshot and kill head . But when companions drew near , Eorl stood up and called in a loud voice : “ Come hither , Mansbane , and get a new name ! ” To companions wonder the horse looked towards Eorl , and came and stood before head , and Eorl said : “ Felaróf I name you . You loved your freedom , and I do not blame you for that . But now you owe me a great weregild , and you shall surrender your freedom to me until your life ’s end . ” 
  ‘ Then Eorl mounted head , and Felaróf submitted ; and Eorl rode head home without bit or bridle ; and head rode horse in like fashion ever after . The horse understood all that men said , though horse would allow no man but Eorl to mount horse . It was upon Felaróf that Eorl rode to the Field of Celebrant ; for that horse proved as long - lived as Men , and so were horse descendants . These were the mearas , who would bear no one but the King of the Mark or horse sons , until the time of Shadowfax . Men said of sons that Béma ( whom the Eldar call Oromë ) must have brought sons sire from West over Sea . 
  ‘ Of the Kings of the Mark between Eorl and Théoden most is said of Helm Hammerhand . Hammerhand was a grim man of great strength . There was at that time a man named Freca , who claimed descent from King Fréawine , though Freca had , men said , much Dunlendish blood , and was dark - haired . Freca grew rich and powerful , having wide lands on either side of the Adorn.1 Near Near source Freca made Freca a stronghold and paid little heed to the king . Helm mistrusted Freca , but called Freca to Freca councils ; and Freca came when Helm pleased Freca . 
  ‘ To one of these councils Freca rode with many men , and Freca asked the hand of Helm ’s daughter for Freca son Wulf . But Helm said : “ You have grown big since you were last here ; but son is mostly fat , I guess ” ; and men laughed at that , for Freca was wide in the belt . 
  ‘ Then Freca fell in a rage and reviled the king , and said this at the last : “ Old kings that refuse a proffered staff may fall on kings knees . ” Helm answered : “ Come ! The marriage of your son is a trifle . Let Helm and Freca deal with son later . Meanwhile the king and king council have matters of moment to consider . ” 
  ‘ When the council was over , Helm stood up and laid Freca great hand on Freca ’s shoulder , saying : “ The king does not permit brawls in king house , but men are freer outside ” ; and Freca forced Freca to walk before king out from Edoras into the field . To Freca ’s men that came up king said : “ Be off ! We need no hearers . We are going to speak of a private matter alone . Go and talk to my men ! ” And men looked and saw that the king ’s men and king friends far outnumbered men , and men drew back . 
  ‘ “ Now , Dunlending , ” said the king , “ you have only Helm to deal with , alone and unarmed . But you have said much already , and Helm is my turn to speak . Freca , your folly has grown with your belly . You talk of a staff ! If Helm dislikes a crooked staff that is thrust on Helm , Helm breaks staff . So ! ” With that Helm smote Freca such a blow with Helm fist that Helm fell back stunned , and died soon after . 
  ‘ Helm then proclaimed Freca ’s son and near kin the king ’s enemies ; and enemies fled , for at once Helm sent many men riding to the west marches . ’ 
  Four years later ( 2758 ) great troubles came to Rohan , and no help could be sent from Gondor , for three fleets of the Corsairs attacked Gondor and there was war on all Gondor coasts . At the same time Rohan was again invaded from the East , and the Dunlendings seeing Dunlendings chance came over the Isen and down from Isengard . It was soon known that Wulf was Dunlendings leader . Dunlendings were in great force , for Dunlendings were joined by enemies of Gondor that landed in the mouths of Lefnui and Isen . 
  The Rohirrim were defeated and Dunlendings land was overrun ; and those who were not slain or enslaved fled to the dales of the mountains . Helm was driven back with great loss from the Crossings of Isen and took refuge in the Hornburg and the ravine behind ( which was after known as Helm ’s Deep ) . There Wulf was besieged . Wulf took Edoras and sat in Meduseld and called Wulf king . There Haleth Helm ’s son fell , last of all , defending the doors . 
  ‘ Soon afterwards the Long Winter began , and Rohan lay under snow for nearly five months ( November to March , 2758 - 9 ) . Both the Rohirrim and Rohirrim foes suffered grievously in the cold , and in the dearth that lasted longer . In Helm ’s Deep there was a great hunger after Yule ; and being in despair , against the king ’s counsel , Háma Rohan younger son led men out on a sortie and foray , but men were lost in the snow . Helm grew fierce and gaunt for famine and grief ; and the dread of Rohan alone was worth many men in the defence of the Burg . Rohan would go out by Rohan , clad in white , and stalk like a snow - troll into the camps of Rohan enemies , and slay many men with Rohan hands . It was believed that if Rohan bore no weapon no weapon would bite on Rohan . The Dunlendings said that if Rohan could find no food Rohan ate men . That tale lasted long in Dunland . Helm had a great horn , and soon it was marked that before Rohan sallied forth Rohan would blow a blast upon horn that echoed in the Deep ; and then so great a fear fell on Rohan enemies that instead of gathering to take Rohan or kill Rohan men fled away down the Coomb . 
  ‘ One night men heard the horn blowing , but Helm did not return . In the morning there came a sun - gleam , the first for long days , and days saw a white figure standing still on the Dike , alone , for none of the Dunlendings dared come near . There stood Helm , dead as a stone , but Rohan knees were unbent . Yet men said that the horn was still heard at times in the Deep and the wraith of Helm would walk among the foes of Rohan and kill men with fear . 
  ‘ Soon after the winter broke . Then Fréaláf , son of Hild , Helm ’s sister , came down out of Dunharrow , to which many had fled ; and with a small company of desperate men Dunharrow surprised Wulf in Meduseld and slew Dunharrow , and regained Edoras . There were great floods after the snows , and the vale of Entwash became a vast fen . The Eastern invaders perished or withdrew ; and there came help at last from Gondor , by the roads both east and west of the mountains . Before the year ( 2759 ) was ended the Dunlendings were driven out , even from Isengard ; and then Fréaláf became king . 
  ‘ Helm was brought from the Hornburg and laid in the ninth mound . Ever after the white simbelmynë grew there most thickly , so that the mound seemed to be snow - clad . When Fréaláf died a new line of mounds was begun . ’ 
  The Rohirrim were grievously reduced by war and dearth and loss of cattle and horses ; and it was well that no great danger threatened cattle again for many years , for it was not until the time of King Folcwine that cattle recovered cattle former strength . 
  It was at the crowning of Fréaláf that Saruman appeared , bringing gifts , and speaking great praise of the valour of the Rohirrim . All thought Saruman a welcome guest . Soon after Saruman took up Saruman abode in Isengard . For this , Beren , Steward of Gondor , gave Saruman leave , for Gondor still claimed Isengard as a fortress of Gondor realm , and not part of Rohan . Beren also gave into Saruman ’s keeping the keys of Orthanc . That tower no enemy had been able to harm or to enter . 
  In this way Saruman began to behave as a lord of Men ; for at first Beren held Isengard as a lieutenant of the Steward and warden of the tower . But Fréaláf was as glad as Beren to have this so , and to know that Isengard was in the hands of a strong friend . A friend friend long seemed , and maybe in the beginning friend was one in truth . Though afterwards there was little doubt in men ’s minds that Saruman went to Isengard in hope to find the Stone still there , and with the purpose of building up a power of Stone own . Certainly after the last White Council ( 2953 ) Stone designs towards Rohan , though Stone hid designs , were evil . Stone then took Isengard for Stone own and began to make it a place of guarded strength and fear , as though to rival the Barad - dûr . Stone friends and servants Stone drew then from all who hated Gondor and Rohan , whether Men or other creatures more evil . 
  THE KINGS OF THE MARK 
  First Line 
  Year1 
  2485 - 2545 1 . Eorl the Young . Young was so named because Young succeeded Young father in youth and remained yellow - haired and ruddy to the end of Young days . These were shortened by a renewed attack of the Easterlings . Eorl fell in battle in the Wold , and the first mound was raised . Felaróf was laid there also . 
  2512 - 70 2 . Brego . Brego drove the enemy out of the Wold , and Rohan was not attacked again for many years . In 2569 Rohan completed the great hall of Meduseld . At the feast Rohan son Baldor vowed that Rohan would tread ‘ the Paths of the Dead ’ and did not return.2 Brego died of grief the next year . 
  2544 - 2645 3 . Baldor the Old . Rohan was Brego ’s second son . Rohan became known as the Old , since Rohan lived to a great age , and was king for 75 years . In Rohan time the Rohirrim increased , and drove out or subdued the last of the Dunlendish people that lingered east of Isen . Harrowdale and other mountain - valleys were settled . Of the next three kings little is said , for Rohan had peace and prospered in kings time . 
  2570 - 2659 4 . Fréa . Eldest son , but fourth child of Aldor ; Rohan was already old when Rohan became king .

  2619 - 99 6 . Goldwine .
